page.title: 04Down By The River Avon.
page.content: Most of the housing by the{River {Avon}in the{Milston}area was thatched. We studied a good example of this style.The thatch had a covering of chicken wire and the walls of the house were made of flint and brick. Near the house a narrow path winds away to reveal the{landscape}by the River Avon to be mainly tree and flower. On the sides of the path there were a great many Jack-O-The-Pulpit.Down the same path we saw a strange tree that had fungi growth all over it. At Milston the River Avon was about 20 metres wide.In the fields nearby the majority of the{trees}were Horse-Chestnut.Others included Sycamore,Oak and Beech.
